entry.title: Let ScreenAI service have concurrent data models in memory.
entry.content:
ScreenAI service runs a single thread and if library initialization

requests are received for different services, it runs them sequentially.

However it loads the model files for initialization async and while it

is reading model files for one, an init request for the other service

my arrive.



We can block this in the browser side (and make sure a second init

request is not sent when one is in progress), but that will make the

service router more complicated. Instead this CL removes the limitation

of having only one set of model data in memory and allows reading model

data for two (or more) services at the same time.



This can result in more memory for the fraction of second that the

library is initializing the first service, and all model data files are

released when initializations are completed.



Browser tests are added to verify this [rare] situation.

entry.title: [CloudOpenMetrics] Add crash keys before dumping state
entry.content:
Crash reports are sent with DumpWithoutCrashing() whenever the

CloudOpenMetrics object detects a metric is inconsistent. Add crash keys

which distinguish which metric had what inconsistency to

make the crash reports query-able.



For example, if Task Result is Incorrectly Not Logged for the OneDrive

flow, the key is "CloudOpenMetrics-INL" and the value is

"FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.TaskResult.OneDrive".



The query in go/crash would be:

```

EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM UNNEST(productdata) WHERE key='CloudOpenMetrics

INL' AND value='FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.TaskResult.OneDrive') AND

product_name="Chrome_ChromeOS"

```



Bug: b/322064620

Change-Id: I6486a5fb82249b3b9947cb4b118776afa4e32f9c

entry.title: Reland "Add basic logic for positioning the Picker widget near the caret."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 1a754aaf4bbf5bc9352e55a32f537cce0e43dcba



The original CL kept a const reference to the screen work area while

computing Picker bounds. This failed sanitizer tests since we don't

know the lifetime of the screen- it could be a temporary fake screen.



To fix this, copy the screen work area instead: see diff between

Patchset 1 and Patchset 3.



(Also make some other changes so that we're not overriding Layout()

to set the Picker widget bounds. See Patchset 4 and onwards.)



Original change's description:

> Add basic logic for positioning the Picker widget near the caret.

>

> - If there is space to the right of the caret, place the Picker widget

> to the right of the caret and try to vertically align the Picker

> search field with the caret.

> - Otherwise, place the Picker widget above or below the caret.

>

> Since we want to align the Picker search field with the caret, we only

> position the Picker widget after PickerView layout has happened.

>

> Note that various cases still need to be dealt with (e.g. when there is

> a selection instead of a caret). We'll handle these cases in followups.

>

> Bug: b:320787410, b:322281223

> Change-Id: I7cf427f3c8aa1e229c7a1cdcae1e3939457905aa

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5233749

> Commit-Queue: Michelle Chen

> Reviewed-by: Darren Shen

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1251950}

entry.title: snap-group: SVOVS creation revamp
entry.content:
This cl completed the major revamp of the SVOVS creation by

focusing on the following items:

1. Don't bypass SVOVS creation in `WindowState::OnWMEvent()`;

2. Remove `auto_snap_controller_` owned by SVOVS as the instance

has been owned by `SplitViewController`, with this cl SVOVS can only

by created through `SplitViewController`;

3. Refresh snapped window bounds upon snap group creation and removal

by adjusting current API;

4. Unify handling when divider is created in clamshell in

`SplitViewDivider::RefreshSplitViewDividerInClamshell()`;

5. Further reduce the misusages of the feature flag;

6. Remove the !InSplitViewMode() in `SplitViewController` when it

doesn't make sense.



TODO:

- The snapped window bounds calculation differ between clamshell and

tablet split view with the existence of divider. This needs to be

unified, currently the calculation in snap group is correct;

- Re-enable the unit test when divider refactor work completes.



Fixed: b/321093825

Test: Update / fix existing tests + manual

entry.title: Add fuzzy matching to BackgroundImage test
entry.content:
Adds a fuzzy matching algorithm to the Pixel_BackgroundImage test to

allow any number of pixels to differ by up to 1 on each channel. This

test produces a fairly detailed image and has historically had a lot of

off-by-one differences, so this should hopefully reduce the number of

images that need to be manually triaged in a safe way.

entry.title: documentScan: Simplify scanner id token tracking
entry.content:
The backend now generates per-client anonymized tokens for scanners

instead of returning the SANE connection. This allows the backend to

make use of its more detailed knowledge of device availability to change

the tokens when needed instead of on every GetScannerList call.



Since these tokens are already anonymous, DocumentScanAPIHandler no

longer needs to replace them with its own tokens. Instead, remove all

that tracking logic and just track the set of active scanner IDs for

each extension. Now that the handler is able to clear scanner IDs per

extension instead of globally, it also makes sense to clear the lists of

scanner handles and job handles at the same time to avoid having them

grow indefinitely.



Finally, this also removes the shared scanner_devices map in favor of

tracking directly inside ExtensionState. The keys provided by the

backend are no longer shared across extensions, so each extension is

effectively only accessing a disjoint slice of the shared map anyway.



Bug: b/316152239

Bug: b/315310310

Test: Scan with test extension

Change-Id: Ic0351e42d3b087369068c9833efe10063120ab09

entry.title: [iOS] Correct lazy load for incognito blocker overlay view
entry.content:
Incognito blocker overlay view is designed to load lazily, but the lazy

loading progress breaks due to the wrong getter method being used. So

the view is initialized on startup, which adds ~8ms to the startup

latency on the iPhone 7 (according to Instruments).



Instruments measurements:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1gyVFWPn2WDPIyi5zY1WFUjhsL2Z26RsUyHLNw87lIWE/edit?usp=sharing

entry.title: [shared storage] Add the shared-backing-thread implementation behind a feature
entry.content:
We switched to the owning-backing-thread model recently

(https://crrev.com/c/5142609) as a speculative fix for a crash that

occurs in the wild. Even though the speculative fix seems to have

fixed the problem, we still want to investigate the root cause of

the crash that occurred on the previous threading model (i.e. we plan

to add loggings to v8 and expose it in the crash log to help

investigate). Thus, we add back the shared-backing-thread

implementation and put it behind a flag so we can control the

traffic (crash rate) via Finch.



Bug: 1501387

entry.title: Fix dangling pointer in PermissionAuditingService.
entry.content:
Prior to this change the `db_` member var (PermissionAuditingDatabase)

in PermissionAuditingService was a raw_ptr that was created with `new`

when calling PermissionAuditingService::Init(). This appeared to cause a

across task dangling because the `DeleteSoon()` task is what `delete`s

the memory rather than PermissionAuditingService. But this appears

intentional.



After this change `db_` is now a std::unique_ptr to better reflect

ownership.



Fixed: 1512674

entry.title: Don't include OnePlatform path in the names of security domains.
entry.content:
The new Javascript API (behind the `SetClientEncryptionKeysJsApi`

feature flag) names security domains like "chromesync", not with the

full OnePlatform name that the code currently expects[1]. Martin

says that this is correct because it's how the other platforms name

security domain.



Thus this change defines the "name" of a security domain to be just

"chromesync" or "hw_protected". Code that deals with OnePlatform now

deals with the "path" of the security domain.

entry.title: [blinkpy] Detect if WPT manifests need updating
entry.content:
Most tools must update WPT manifests to accurately catalog what WPTs

exist, but this operation requires stat'ing the entire WPT tree and is

the primary contributor to slow startup (~10s on my machine).



To improve local tool UX, this change allows `blinkpy` to detect whether

an update is needed by checking if a hash of the WPT directory's

contents changed from the last update. This adds ~1s in fixed overhead

but should almost always skip updating the `wpt_internal/` manifest,

which itself takes >1s (so autodetection pays for itself).



For now, this feature is only activated for `lint_test_expectations.py`.



Bug: 1492238, 1411505

Test: rm -rf ../../wpt_tools/wpt/.wptcache

Test: time bash -c 'for i in $(seq 0 7); do ./lint_test_expectations.py; done'

Test: 1:28 without patch -> 0:45 with patch

Change-Id: I8f0fd4170ee16031a3f5ec399e864feec6993918

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5232061

Reviewed-by: Weizhong Xia

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1253658}

entry.title: Fix difference in Fluent scrollbar grays caused by their alpha
entry.content:
Fluent scrollbars grays are currently achieved by applying a certain

transparency to a pure white (255, 255, 255) or black (0,0,0) color.

This CL changes the way to achieve the desired color from applying an

alpha to a white or black, to directly setting the color of the gray

that we want with an alpha of 1.

The reason for this change is that the transparencies cause light mode

scrollbar gray parts (non-hovered) to be painted with different shades

of gray. Main threaded thumbs are being drawn at a shade of gray darker

than composited scrollbars' thumbs, and win10 arrows are also being

drawn with a darker gray.

This doesn't happen in dark mode, nor with the hovered/pressed colors,

but these colors are receiving the same treatment in order to avoid

potential future problems.

The new colors were chosen by picking the final rendered color of

the scrollbar parts. For example, light themed non-hovered gray is a

gray with the RGB values (139,139,139).



The root cause of this issue is suspected to be caused by a different

rounding mechanism used to apply the alpha in the different call ops.

For example, for win10 vs win11 arrows, the color is the same but the

skia paint function called is different (see

NativeThemeFluent::PaintArrow).



Most rebaselines are due to a few anti aliasing pixels containing

different values, except for win10 arrows and main threaded thumbs

which are completely replaced by the new selected color.



Bug: 1517769

entry.title: [Hub] Fix Hub re-entrancy crash
entry.content:
When the HubLayout is shown consecutively calling super.doneHiding()

before the rest of the subclass's cleanup leads to the HubContainerView

being attached a second time before it is removed leading to an

exception that if not present would still result in a very bad state

for the Hub.



Fix this by re-sequencing super.doneHiding() to happen after the rest

of teardown. I tested and no layout frame is shown with "bad" UI so

this should be fine.



We could alternatively prevent re-showing the LayoutType.TAB_SWITCHER

in LayoutManagerImpl#showLayout(). However, this feels like more of a

bandaid. Ultimately, we should probably assert on re-entering

LayoutType.TAB_SWITCHER in showLayout(); however, let's land a fix

first and add the assert in a follow-up.



Fixed: 1522983

entry.title: [OOPIF PDF] Replace old streams with new streams
entry.content:
Replace old PDF streams with new streams. When the top frame navigates

to a PDF URL, a stream will be made. If the top frame reloads or

navigates to a new PDF URL, a new stream must be created and used to

load the PDF again. Adjust comments to explain this.



This fixes a bug where the PDF doesn't fully load if the full-page PDF

viewer reloads or if it navigates to another PDF URL.



Also rename the corresponding test to better represent what it is

actually testing.

entry.title: [A11y] Better handling of tree updates in non-main document
entry.content:
Speculative fix for check that is triggered for tree update in a

secondary document that is not a tracked popup document.



- Throw away tree updates that occur BEFORE the popup is tracked in

a11y. Once the popup is newly created, we will build its internal tree

from scratch anyway

- Throw away tree updates that occur AFTER the popup is no longer

tracked in a11y. This means the popup is currently closing and there

are no updates of interest in it.

- Add a check to ensure that if there is a main and popup document, that

there isn't a tree update in yet a third document, because popup

documents are the only non-main documents that can exist where we

can get an update in this AXObjectCacheImpl.

entry.title: `StrictNumeric` in `base::span::first(...)` and `last(...)`: Prep 1/N.
entry.content:
This CL prepares for using `StrictNumeric` (instead of just

`size_t`) as the type of a parameter taken by `base::span::first` and/or

`base::span::last` methods. This is done by tweaking callers of these

methods to ensure that they either:



* Pass a `size_t` value as an argument, or

* Pass size as a compile-time argument (e.g. `some_span.first<123>()`)



This CL also opportunistically performs a similar change for some

callers of `base::span::subspan`.

other platforms.



We can remove this once the new CursorAnchorInfoMojoPipe is set up which

will only get established on Android as Android code will own one of the

endpoints. When ReportVisibleLineBounds flag is removed, platforms

relevant code leaving it effectively "disabled" on those platforms to

entry.title: Hub updates scrim color on incog change.
entry.content:
Previously when the Hub was opened, the status bar was not correctly

updating to match the incognito state. The way this was set up, is

that while the StatusBarColorController watches the TabModelSelector,

on tablets there is a full opacity scrim over the status bar while the

hub is being shown. And so this scrim needs to track the correct

color.



To fix this, the Hub now takes an *Observable*Supplier for

incognito state. Since all we had was an ObservableSupplier,

created UnwrapObservableSupplier to proxy the TabModel into a Boolean.

This incog state is then used to modify the scrim's BACKGROUND_COLOR

while the scrim is being shown. Which the scrim needs to now watch for

and update/proxy when it is modified.



Bug: b/320526489

Change-Id: I8215c727b1807a2d39235a130d6cbffa3c127fbc

entry.title: Remove default ConstraintSpace() constructor.
entry.content:
Prior to the rename of NGConstraintSpace to ConstraintSpace, there was a

ConstraintSpace() getter in LayoutAlgorithm, which then got renamed to

GetConstraintSpace(). In other words, when writing code in

LayoutAlgorithm classes now, the expression ConstraintSpace() means

something completely different (and I've walked into that trap several

times already).



Just get rid of this constructor, and update some MathML code and unit

tests that used to rely on it.



No behavior changes intended.

entry.title: Hook attribution request helper in KeepAliveUrlLoader
entry.content:
This CL is the last step to enable processing Attribution background

registrations requests’ responses in the browser process.



See go/ara-keepalive-dd for details.



Two flags must be enabled for this hook to be used.

1. kKeepAliveInBrowserMigration (bit.ly/chromium-keepalive-migration)

2. kAttributionReportingInBrowserMigration (this hook)



In this CL, when needed (for attribution eligible requests), we add a

hook in the loader. The hook will receive responses and process the ones

containing attribution headers.



[Note] Currently, this new code path is not covered by WPT test as the

`KeepAliveInBrowserMigration` is not enabled in the virtual attribution

test suite. I tried creating a new WPT test suite to run both flow.

However, the two suites running in parallel were affecting each other.

Making the change locally, the ARA WPT tests do pass with the

`KeepAliveInBrowserMigration` flag enabled.



Bug: 1374121,1519958

Change-Id: I2006f456d8a0c3bff411943459abda7e8e3d1d1f

entry.title: Buffer navigation-tied OS registrations
entry.content:
To prevent an input event from being re-used, it will be required that

all registrations tied to a single navigation (triggered by an input

event), be sent as a batch.



In this CL, navigation tied foreground and background OS registrations

are buffered in the attribution_data_host_manager. They are still sent

as individual requests by calling the existing method.



A shared timeout is used for trigger buffering and OS registrations

buffering. This timeout is set to 20s. The trigger buffering timeout is

therefore increased from 10s to 20s when background registrations are

enabled.



Change-Id: I73ab4b216d9f3f0a5b92fb9b23e509b76cfba907

entry.title: Improve ChromeOS's crash_reporter's early-crash code's crashpad detection
entry.content:
ChromeOS's crash_reporter's early-crash detection is flaky and

crash_reporter's UserCollector keeps trying to collect Chrome crashes

that it shouldn't -- and then failing because the core files are too

big. This wastes a lot of time and generates a lot of unwanted

crash-reporter-failure reports.



This CL + the corresponding changes in the ChromeOS repo will switch

to a better way of detecting that crashpad is initialized: Letting

Chrome tell crash_reporter directly. Specifically, the ChromeOS device

will now have a directory, /run/crash_reporter/crashpad_ready, and

Chrome will touch a file named /run/crash_reporter/crashpad_ready/

as soon as it has initialized crashpad. UserCollector will then use the

presence of that file to detect that crashpad is ready and know that

UserCollector doesn't need to collect the crash.



https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/platform2/+/5174532

will need to be checked in first so that the

/run/crash_reporter/crashpad_ready directory is ready. After this CL is

checked in,

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/platform2/+/5174770

will actually switch UserCollector to use the new files.



BUG=b:292578303,b:244787525

TEST=Signed in, signed out, entered guest mode, exited guest mode.

Ensured files in /run/crash_reporter/crashpad_ready always

corresponded to current ash & lacros processes (except when in guest

mode, when Chrome is given a namespace'd /run directory). Ensured files

were cleaned up correctly.



Change-Id: I2daa905e0b3e4b388434a227e1894f0980641ba0

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5172376

Reviewed-by: Rick Byers

Commit-Queue: Ian Barkley-Yeung

entry.title: blink: optimizes Element::ClassChanged
entry.content:
This adds a couple of tweaks to ClassChanged:

. Don't do anything. This can happen if parsing and ElementData is already

up to date (and not in the active document). In this case there is no

additional processing needed (because ElementData is already up to date,

and ClassChangedForElement() early outs if not in the active document).

. If we've already cached the class name, then no need to parse it.

entry.title: Add LayoutSuperclass<>() and DeprecatedLayoutImmediately().
entry.content:
LayoutSuperclass<>() invokes Layout() on behalf of a subclass. It will

be used to replace calls to base class Layout() implementations from

inside Layout() overrides.



DeprecatedLayoutImmediately() is a public accessor to

LayoutImmediately(). It will be used for all other Layout() calls, to

make it clear these will eventually be removed.

entry.title: display: Turn on unified mode not count to new display connected metrics
entry.content:
Unified desktop mode uses hard coded fake display id, which also

counts to the kNewDisplayConnectedHistogram metric. However, unified

desktop mode doesn't really have a new display connected, which

shouldn't count. This CL filters out unified desktop mode.



Bug: b/314324856

entry.title: Add LayoutImmediately().
entry.content:
This synchronously invokes Layout(). For now, it does nothing else, but

eventually it can do any pre-layout work necessary, e.g. collecting

metrics or setting state/access control variables.



Ultimately, this should become the only way for any code to reach

Layout().
